name: Department of the Navy
description: The Department of the Navy includes both the United States Navy and the United States Marine Corps, responsible for naval warfare and expeditionary operations.

painPoints.point: Shipyard Infrastructure Optimization Program (SIOP) cost explosion - first 3 dry dock projects grew by $4B, Pearl Harbor alone increased from $6.1B to $16B
painPoints.source: GAO-23-106067 Navy Readiness & GAO-22-105993 Naval Shipyards Reports

painPoints.point: SIOP planning delays - detailed shipyard investment plans delayed 3 years, now won't be complete until FY2025
Growing deferred maintenance backlog - increased by $1.6B over 5 years, now totals over $7 billion
painPoints.source: GAO-22-105993 Naval Shipyards Report & Federal News Network May 2022

painPoints.point: Aging equipment crisis - more than half of shipyard capital equipment past expected service life
Columbia-class submarine program budget pressure - $126.4B total cost for 12 boats, $3.3B FY2025 for boat 2
painPoints.source: Navy Columbia Class CRS Report R41129 & Congress Report February 2025

painPoints.point: Cybersecurity for naval platforms - split responsibility between NAVWAR (networks) and NAVSEA (combat systems) requiring coordination
painPoints.source: NAVSEA Cybersecurity Campaign Plan & NAVSEA Media News

painPoints.point: Private shipyard industrial base investment challenges requiring strategic approach
Autonomous systems integration and AI/ML tool deployment across unmanned platforms
painPoints.source: NAVWAR WEST 2025 Conference & Pentagon FY2026 Budget Autonomy Allocation

painPoints.point: Weapon systems acquisition delays including Ship to Shore Connector Amphibious Craft experiencing 15-month delays due to testing problems, reflecting broader Navy acquisition process challenges
painPoints.source: GAO Testimony 2024 - Weapon Systems Acquisition Delays

strategicPriorities.priority: Shipyard Infrastructure Optimization Program (SIOP) - 20-year, $21B+ modernization effort (now significantly over budget)
strategicPriorities.funding: Originally $21B, now significantly higher due to cost overruns

strategicPriorities.priority: Columbia-class ballistic missile submarine production - 12 boats, transition to 1 per year starting FY2026
strategicPriorities.source: Navy CRS Report R41129 & FY2025 Budget Request
strategicPriorities.funding: $126.4B total, $3.3B FY2025 for boat 2, $6.2B advance procurement

strategicPriorities.priority: Unmanned and autonomous systems expansion - $5.3B for all autonomy systems (+$2.2B increase)
strategicPriorities.source: Pentagon FY2026 Budget Request & DefenseScoop June 2025
strategicPriorities.funding: $5.3B Navy autonomy systems FY2026 (+$2.2B from FY2025)

strategicPriorities.priority: SeaPort Next Generation (SeaPort NxG) professional services acquisition - 1,023 contractors awarded January 2025
strategicPriorities.source: NAVSEA SeaPort NxG & 2025 Rolling Admissions II Awards

strategicPriorities.priority: Cybersecurity across naval platforms - NAVSEA Campaign Plan priority for hull, mechanical, electrical, combat systems
strategicPriorities.source: NAVSEA Enterprise Strategy January 2025 & Cybersecurity Campaign Plan

strategicPriorities.priority: AI/ML and autonomous warfare capabilities - multi-domain warfare innovation focus
strategicPriorities.source: NAVWAR WEST 2025 Conference & NAVWAR Commander Rear Adm. Okano remarks

strategicPriorities.priority: Shipbuilding industrial base strengthening - systemic change required per GAO
strategicPriorities.source: GAO-25-108136 Navy Shipbuilding Generational Imperative Report

insights: SeaPort NxG awarded 1,023 contractors January 2025 with 85% small business participation - major opportunity vehicle
SIOP cost overruns are severe - first 3 dry docks alone exceeded original $4B budget for all 17 dry docks
Pearl Harbor shipyard estimate exploded from $6.1B to $16B - massive construction opportunity but high risk
$7B deferred maintenance backlog growing despite $21B+ SIOP investment - sustained contracting need
Columbia-class represents $126.4B submarine program through 2035 - predictable annual procurement starting FY2026
$5.3B in Navy autonomy systems FY2026 (+$2.2B increase) - unmanned systems priority area
Cybersecurity split between NAVWAR (networks) and NAVSEA (combat systems) creates opportunities in both domains
GAO has 9 open recommendations on SIOP - compliance and risk management contracts likely
More than half of shipyard equipment past service life - equipment replacement contracts imminent
85% of SeaPort contracts go to small businesses - strongest small business preference of any Navy vehicle
